title: CKA Practice: Persistent Volumes and PVC
description: Learn how to create a PersistentVolume, PersistentVolumeClaim, and use them in a pod while verifying data persistence after pod deletion.

steps.title: Step 1 - Create PersistentVolume
steps.text:
Create a file called `pv.yaml` and define a PersistentVolume:

```yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: PersistentVolume
metadata:
  name: my-pv
spec:
  capacity:
    storage: 1Gi
  accessModes:
    - ReadWriteOnce
  hostPath:
    path: /mnt/data
```

Apply it:
```bash
kubectl apply -f pv.yaml
kubectl get pv
```

steps.title: Step 2 - Create PersistentVolumeClaim
steps.text:
Create a file called `pvc.yaml` with the following:

```yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: PersistentVolumeClaim
metadata:
  name: my-pvc
spec:
  accessModes:
    - ReadWriteOnce
  resources:
    requests:
      storage: 500Mi
```

Apply it:
```bash
kubectl apply -f pvc.yaml
kubectl get pvc
```

steps.title: Step 3 - Create Pod with PVC
steps.text:
Create `pod.yaml`:

```yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: pv-test-pod
spec:
  containers:
    - name: busybox
      image: busybox
      command: ["sh", "-c", "sleep 3600"]
      volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: "/data"
          name: my-storage
  volumes:
    - name: my-storage
      persistentVolumeClaim:
        claimName: my-pvc
```

Apply it:
```bash
kubectl apply -f pod.yaml
kubectl get pods
```

steps.title: Step 4 - Write Data to PV
steps.text:
Write to the mounted volume:

```bash
kubectl exec -it pv-test-pod -- sh -c "echo 'Hello from PV!' > /data/hello.txt"
```

Check the file:
```bash
kubectl exec -it pv-test-pod -- cat /data/hello.txt
```

steps.title: Step 5 - Delete and Recreate Pod
steps.text:
Delete and recreate the pod:

```bash
kubectl delete pod pv-test-pod
kubectl apply -f pod.yaml
```

steps.title: Step 6 - Verify Data Persistence
steps.text:
Check if the file still exists:

```bash
kubectl exec -it pv-test-pod -- cat /data/hello.txt
```
âœ… Expected: `Hello from PV!`

intro.text: In this scenario, you will create Kubernetes PersistentVolumes and PersistentVolumeClaims from scratch, mount them in a pod, and verify that data persists after the pod is deleted.

finish.text: You have successfully created a PV, PVC, mounted it to a pod, and confirmed persistence after deletion.
